A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Why did Disney / Rian Johnson see fit to take such a huge gamble with the direction of the Skywalker trilogy of trilogies in what was its penultimate act?

If anything this movie needed to be the glue holding VII and IX together but for me it just destroyed the Skywalker saga with a whole film to go. Astounding. I just dont get the thought process.

I think Rian Johnson and Disney will ultimately pay for a price for this move further down the linear well they should. As for the critics score\, they either know nothing about Star Wars or have been paid off. 

Im ok with taking Star Wars to new places. But this went way too far and it just ended up being a complete mess of a movie. One that lacked script\, plot\, meaningful direction and cohesion. 

The time to take a gamble on a new direction for Star Wars was after IX\, not at such a crucial point in the saga as VIII.

A shameful travesty of a film that openly mocks a cultural institution that has brought joy to so many people for over 40 years.
